description:
《英文天天写》是沪江社团一档写作类社刊，其目的在于提升大家的英语写作能力。每期节目主持人都会给出一个话题，积极参加的童鞋还会得到主持人的专业点评哦！想提高英语写作的童鞋千万不要错过哦！去沪江社团订阅本社刊！

    

话题：

Writing: imagine a scenario or express your opinion
Doppelganger
A doppelganger is a duplicate of a living person. Who does the doppelganger look like? Where was the doppelganger seen?
This week's topic: They thought they saw a doppelganger... (90-110 words)

Suggestions:
1) doppelganger of a celebrity
2) doppelganger of someone from a history textbook
3) saw a doppelganger walking down the street
4) a doppelganger living in another country
5) Instead of writing a scenario, feel free to comment on the story below.

范例1：

Then again, Al's eyesight was not bad. In fact, he had twenty-twenty vision, without needing to wear glasses nor contact lenses. What Al saw was not only the face, but the way the figure moved also caught his attention. Everything Al observed reminded him of someone he knew from a long time ago. Don't they always say we all have doppelganger somewhere in the world? Al thought to himself, though he must admit that the resemblance was uncanny. Up until he reached where he intended to go, Al was processing and organizing his thoughts.

想要得到专业主持人的点评和意见吗？快来节目现场一试身手吧>>

title: 英文天天写：Doppelganger

description:
Well, last week was another tough one for oil markets. Brent Crude, the standard European measure of the oil price, slipped below $50 for the first time in some five years or so. Speaking at an investor conference in India, Jim Yong Kim, President of the World Bank, said that the falling oil price represented an opportunity for much of the global economy.

If you look at the average price of oil in 2014, and the average price of oil in 2015, our analysis suggests that if there is a 30% reduction in price and that's average price year-to-year, global growth will go up 0.5%. So overall for the global economy, it's a good thing. But of course, we work with all the different countries, so there're winners and losers. It's a huge concern for the Russian economy. It's a huge concern for the Nigerian economy. There're many oil exporting countries for which this is a really big problem. But here in India, it's a source of a very important tailwind for growth. Countries like Indonesia, China are all experiencing tailwinds from the fact that oil prices are so low. So it's a mixed picture and it's a global picture.

The President of the World Bank. The short-term concern there is not just in oil-producing countries, but for oil-producing firms, some of which are facing a fight for survival amidst the headwinds as Jim Yong Kim might call them.
